Meta Platforms has sued an Israel-based web scraping firm called Bright Data for scraping data from its Facebook and Instagram websites – even though Meta paid Bright Data to scrape data from other websites.…

entry.title: AMD's pricy cache-packed Ryzen 7000X3D CPUs ship this month
entry.summary:
Who needs 6GHz when you can have 128MB of L3

To compete with Intel's fire-breathing 6GHz Core i9-13900KS desktop processors, AMD isn't shipping higher clocked Ryzens, but instead is throwing a boat load of cache at the problem.…

entry.title: FTC prescribes GoodRx a $1.5m pill after 'sharing health info' with web giants
entry.summary:
Facebook, Google, Twilio had a look-see of that data, we're told

GoodRx will cough up $1.5 million to settle claims it shared people's health information with Facebook, Google, and other third parties.…

entry.title: Electricity cut off in city of Sloviansk after Russian shelling.
entry.summary: Mayor of Sloviansk Vadim Lyakh reported that Russian shelling damaged a high-voltage line, but there are no casualties. The post Electricity cut off in city of Sloviansk after Russian shelling. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Zelensky: More than 200,000 Ukrainian children have been deported to Russia.
entry.summary: In his daily address on June 1, President Volodymyr Zelensky said that Russia continues to forcibly move both adults and children into mostly remote areas of Russia, underscoring that this is one of Moscow’s “most heinous war crimes.” He added that the children deported include orphans and children with parents. The post Zelensky: More than 200,000 Ukrainian children have been deported to Russia. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Did the War End? Ep. 1: Introduction
entry.summary: The early hours of Feb. 24, 2022 were not something any Ukrainian could have imagined. It was a very regular night. Then, millions of people across the country woke up to the sounds of explosions, as Russia began its full-scale attack on Ukraine, including its capital, Kyiv. In this episode […] The post Did the War End? Ep. 1: Introduction appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Lviv Oblast Governor: Russian cruise missiles ‘severely damaged’ railway infrastructure.
entry.summary: Governor Maksym Kozytskyi reported that Russia launched a missile overnight from the Black Sea and hit Lviv Oblast. Kozytskyi added that five people were injured, four of whom have been hospitalized. The post Lviv Oblast Governor: Russian cruise missiles ‘severely damaged’ railway infrastructure. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Slovakia to send eight Zuzana 2 howitzers to Ukraine.
entry.summary: The Slovak Defense Ministry said that the self-propelled Zuzana 2 howitzers will be delivered under a commercial contract that a state-controlled producer had signed. The post Slovakia to send eight Zuzana 2 howitzers to Ukraine. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: General Staff: Russia has lost 30,850 troops in Ukraine since Feb. 24.
entry.summary: Ukraine’s General Staff reported on June 2 that Russia had also lost 1,363 tanks, 3,354 armored vehicles, 2,325 vehicles and fuel tanks, 661 artillery pieces, 207 multiple launch rocket systems, 95 air defense systems, 175 helicopters, 210 airplanes, 521 drones, and 13 boats. The post General Staff: Russia has lost 30,850 troops in Ukraine since Feb. 24. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Russia shells Kharkiv overnight, killing one, injuring another.
entry.summary: Kharkiv Oblast Governor Oleh Synehubov said the Russians shelled two city districts during the night. The post Russia shells Kharkiv overnight, killing one, injuring another. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: General Staff: Russia faces shortage of drones.
entry.summary: Ukraine’s military reported that the Russians are losing drones, and they have already begun using the ones owned by the Ministry of Emergency Situations. The post General Staff: Russia faces shortage of drones. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: UK Defense Ministry: Russia continues to make ‘steady local gains,’ takes control of most of Sievierodonetsk.
entry.summary: The U.K. defense ministry said in its daily briefing that Ukraine likely still has control over the main road into the Sievierodonetsk pocket but Russia continues to advance despite heavy losses, enabling a heavy concentration of artillery. It is likely that Russia will need a short tactical pause before attempting […] The post UK Defense Ministry: Russia continues to make ‘steady local gains,’ takes control of most of Sievierodonetsk. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Institute for the Study of War: Russian forces try to advance on Lysychansk to avoid crossing Siversky Donets River.
entry.summary: According to the U.S. think tank, Russian forces have made “incremental advances” north of Sloviansk and Avdiivka, Donetsk Oblast, with “limited success.” The post Institute for the Study of War: Russian forces try to advance on Lysychansk to avoid crossing Siversky Donets River. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Sky News: General confirms US conducts offensive hacking operation in support of Ukraine.
entry.summary: In an interview, NSA Director Paul Nakasone said the U.S. has “conducted a series of operations across the full spectrum; offensive, defensive, [and] information operations” in response to Russia’s full-scale invasion. Nakasone said their activities are lawful and conducted with complete civilian oversight of the military. The post Sky News: General confirms US conducts offensive hacking operation in support of Ukraine. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Stoltenberg: Russia unlikely to retaliate after US provision of advanced weapons to Ukraine.
entry.summary: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg told CNN on June 1 that he does not “foresee that because what NATO allies and NATO is doing is to provide support to Ukraine to uphold the right for self-defense, and this is a right which is enshrined in the UN treaty.” The post Stoltenberg: Russia unlikely to retaliate after US provision of advanced weapons to Ukraine. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: CNN: UK to send Ukraine long-range rocket systems.
entry.summary: The U.K. will send multiple-launch rocket systems, or M270 launchers, to Ukraine, U.K. Defense Secretary Ben Wallace said on June 1. M270 launchers can hit targets up to 80 kilometers away, giving “a significant boost in capability for the Ukrainian forces,” according to a statement from the U.K. Foreign Office. The […] The post CNN: UK to send Ukraine long-range rocket systems. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Reuters: Civilians take shelter in chemical plant as Russia shells Sievierodonetsk.
entry.summary: Luhansk Oblast Governor Serhiy Haidai said authorities fear the Azot chemical plant may still contain dangerous materials. However, he said the situation will not become the “second Azovstal.” The post Reuters: Civilians take shelter in chemical plant as Russia shells Sievierodonetsk. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Reuters: US intends to sell Ukraine armed drones in coming days.
entry.summary: The U.S. plans to sell Ukraine four long-endurance MQ-1C Gray Eagle drones, which can be armed with up to eight Hellfire missiles, undisclosed sources told Reuters. While the sale could still be blocked by Congress, it is significant because it would provide Ukraine with an advanced reusable U.S. system able to […] The post Reuters: US intends to sell Ukraine armed drones in coming days. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Poland to sell Ukraine additional 60 KRAB self-propelled howitzers.
entry.summary: Polish media outlet Dziennik reported that these weapons will be delivered in the next few months. In May, Poland sent 18 KRAB self-propelled howitzers to Ukraine. The post Poland to sell Ukraine additional 60 KRAB self-propelled howitzers. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Lviv Oblast Governor: Russian missile strike injures 5 people.
entry.summary: Maksym Kozytsky said that those injured by the cruise missile strike on Lviv Oblast’s Stryisky District on June 1 are not in critical condition. Kozytsky said more information will be provided in the morning, local time. The post Lviv Oblast Governor: Russian missile strike injures 5 people. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Washington Post: US defends decision to provide Ukraine with HIMARS.
entry.summary: U.S. Under Secretary of Defense for Policy Colin Kahl dismissed criticism that the delayed provision of M142 High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems to Ukraine comes too late, saying they will “arrive in a time frame that’s relevant.” The satellite-guided weapons are the most advanced arms sent to Ukraine by the U.S. […] The post Washington Post: US defends decision to provide Ukraine with HIMARS. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Ukrainian troops repel 13 Russian attacks, destroy military equipment.
entry.summary: Operational Command “East” reports that Ukraine’s forces have repelled 13 Russian attacks in the east of the country. Russia has reportedly lost 20 units of military equipment, including two tanks, six artillery pieces, eight armored combat vehicles and four other vehicles. Additionally, Ukraine’s Air Force downed seven Russian “Orlan-10” UAVs. The post Ukrainian troops repel 13 Russian attacks, destroy military equipment. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: EU imposes partial oil embargo but keeps funding Putin’s war through gas payments
entry.summary: The European Union on May 31 finally agreed on a partial embargo on Russian oil after months of delays and disagreements. However, the move was criticized by some Ukrainians and supporters of Ukraine as “too little and too late.” “If you ask me, I would say far too slow, far […] The post EU imposes partial oil embargo but keeps funding Putin’s war through gas payments appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Kyiv City Prosecutor’s Office investigates Kryukiv Railway Car Building Works over alleged embezzlement to a Russian entity.
entry.summary: The investigation alleges the plant purchased parts for car construction from Russian companies at inflated prices when it could have bought the same parts at a lower price from Ukraine. The post Kyiv City Prosecutor’s Office investigates Kryukiv Railway Car Building Works over alleged embezzlement to a Russian entity. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Gazprom leaves London Stock Exchange.
entry.summary: Gazprom left the London Stock Exchange following the Russian government’s demand that Russian companies quit Western stock markets. The post Gazprom leaves London Stock Exchange. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Russians hit Sloviansk with Iskander missiles, killing 3 people and wounding 6.
entry.summary: The missile attack occurred on May 31, and damaged a school and at least seven residential buildings, according to Pavlo Kyrylenko, the governor of Donetsk Oblast. entry.title: Verkhovna Rada dismisses ombudsman Denisova.
entry.summary: 234 lawmakers voted to dismiss Lyudmyla Denisova. Earlier, Ukrainian journalists and activists have expressed concerns over Denisova’s reports of rapes by Russian soldiers, that were sometimes seen as insensitive or disrespectful towards survivors. The post Verkhovna Rada dismisses ombudsman Denisova. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Austrian chancellor: Next package of Russia sanctions won’t include gas embargo.
entry.summary: Karl Nehammer claimed that it would be much more difficult to replace Russian gas than Russian oil. Earlier the European Union had agreed to impose an embargo on Russian oil with a “temporary exemption” for pipeline oil. European countries have faced criticism for effectively financing Russian aggression against Ukraine by […] The post Austrian chancellor: Next package of Russia sanctions won’t include gas embargo. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: General Staff: One more Russian offensive towards Sloviansk fails.
entry.summary: Ukraine’s General Staff said that Russian troops had unsuccessfully tried to storm the village of Dovhenke near Sloviansk, Donetsk Oblast. Russian troops are also trying to storm Zolote, Komyshuvakha, Nyrkove, Berestove, Pokrovske and Dolomitne near Bakhmut in Donetsk Oblast, the General Staff said. The post General Staff: One more Russian offensive towards Sloviansk fails. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Ukrainian court jails 2 Russian soldiers charged with war crimes.
entry.summary: The court sentenced the two Russians, Alexander Bobykin and Alexander Ivanov, to 11.5 years in prison for shelling residential areas in Kharkiv Oblast. The post Ukrainian court jails 2 Russian soldiers charged with war crimes. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: German defense committee chief urges Scholz to unblock supplies of armored vehicles to Ukraine.
entry.summary: Marie-Agnes Strack-Zimmermann, head of the German parliament’s defense committee, has called on German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s office to deliver 50 Marder infantry fighting vehicles to Ukraine as soon as possible. German media reported earlier that Scholz had blocked Marder supplies for weeks. The post German defense committee chief urges Scholz to unblock supplies of armored vehicles to Ukraine. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: UK Defense Ministry: Russia achieves local successes by massing forces.
entry.summary: The ministry said that the strategy of massing forces and fires in a relatively small area had enabled Russian troops to achieve local successes. In contrast, during the first month of the large-scale invasion, Russia suffered military setbacks after scattering its forces over a huge area. The ministry said that […] The post UK Defense Ministry: Russia achieves local successes by massing forces. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Prosecutor General’s Office: Russia’s war has killed 240 children, injured 436.
entry.summary: The figures are expected to be higher since they do not include child casualties in the areas where hostilities are ongoing and in the occupied areas, the Prosecutor General’s Office said. The post Prosecutor General’s Office: Russia’s war has killed 240 children, injured 436. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: US rejects Russia’s offer to unblock Ukrainian ports in exchange for lifting sanctions.
entry.summary: U.S. Department of State spokesman Ned Price called Russia’s suggestion to unblock Ukrainian ports in exchange for lifting sanctions “empty promises.” “The quickest solution to rising raw material prices and rising food prices around the world is to end the Russians’ brutal war,” Price said. The post US rejects Russia’s offer to unblock Ukrainian ports in exchange for lifting sanctions. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: World Bank President: Russia’s war in Ukraine could trigger global recession.
entry.summary: David Malpass said on May 25 that Europe, China, and the U.S. were seeing slower growth. Meanwhile, shortfalls in fertilizer, food stocks, and energy supplies hit developing countries. The post World Bank President: Russia’s war in Ukraine could trigger global recession. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: UK Intelligence: Russia’s airborne forces ‘heavily involved in several notable tactical failures in Ukraine’
entry.summary: These failures include the attempted advance on Kyiv via Hostomel Airfield in March, the stalled progress on the Izium axis since April, and the recent failed and costly crossings of the Siverskyi Donets River, according to the latest intelligence update by the U.K. Defense Ministry. The misemployment of its elite […] The post UK Intelligence: Russia’s airborne forces ‘heavily involved in several notable tactical failures in Ukraine’ appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: ISW: Russia preparing for Battle of Sievierodonetsk.
entry.summary: The Institute for the Study of War said in its May 25 assessment that the intensity of Russian artillery and air attack, combined with the massing of Russian forces from elsewhere suggests Russia may start its offensive on Sievierodonetsk prior to cutting off Ukrainian ground lines of communication. Russia “may […] The post ISW: Russia preparing for Battle of Sievierodonetsk. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Media: NATO members informally agree not to supply Ukraine with aircraft and tanks
entry.summary: Citing its sources in NATO, the German Press Agency reported that alliance members have informally agreed not to supply the weapons to Ukraine, fearing Russia could see the delivery of Western tanks and combat aircraft as entering the war and take retaliatory measures, German newspaper Die Zeit reported. The post Media: NATO members informally agree not to supply Ukraine with aircraft and tanks appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Nike will not renew franchise agreement with Russian retailer
entry.summary: The company said in a statement that “due to operational challenges in Russia, Nike has made the decision not to renew or enter into any new business commitments,” Russian business daily Vedomosti reported. Earlier in March, Nike said it would temporarily close its Nike-owned and operated stores in Russia but […] The post Nike will not renew franchise agreement with Russian retailer appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Zelensky: ‘The world wasn’t ready for Ukrainian bravery’
entry.summary: “For the bravery of all our people who are not inferior to Russia and continue to defend our state,” President Zelensky said during his nightly address. In reference to doubts early on in the war that Ukraine would be able to withstand Russia’s full-scale war, Zelensky said many “simply did […] The post Zelensky: ‘The world wasn’t ready for Ukrainian bravery’ appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Zelensky: ‘Russia advancing aggressively in east, we need weapons’
entry.summary: In his nightly address, President Zelensky said that while Ukraine’s Armed Forces are resisting Russia’s offensives in the east, in some places Russia outnumbers Ukraine in troops and equipment. “We still need the help of partners, especially weapons for Ukraine. Full help, without exceptions, without restrictions, is enough to win,” […] The post Zelensky: ‘Russia advancing aggressively in east, we need weapons’ appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Despite constant heavy shelling, Sievierodonetsk still accessible
entry.summary: Oleksandr Striuk, head of the Sievierodonetsk city military administration, said despite Russia’s constant attacks, the city is not besieged and has enough Ukrainian troops to hold back Russian forces. Striuk said power and communications systems are down and while the roads remain dangerous, “you can get to the city.” He […] The post Despite constant heavy shelling, Sievierodonetsk still accessible appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.
